message: Also, after DA2 I'd like BioWare to spend as much time on this as possible.
Postponed a bit -- no longer coming this year, but rather in Q1 2012.
It's for the best, really. End of 2011 is way too crowded.
While I'm sad, it will mean more time with Skyrim, so I won't complain too much.
*phew*
This has me worried, though: http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2011-05-04-mass-effect-3-tweaked-for-larger-market
Hmm. I thought ME2 was just about perfect. It was really only the mining which I didn't like.

Given the praise ME2 received, I wouldn't have expected them to veer that drastically for ME3, especially given the time frame. I'm not opposed to changes, obviously, but how much broader can ME2 get without becoming a straight up shooter?

This smacks a little of the changes they made moving from DA1 to DA2.
http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2011-05-11-new-mass-effect-3-details
Eurogamer has some new details, along with clearly demarcated spoilers towards the end. Loving everything I'm hearing, except for one gameplay detail in the spoiler section.
Yeah, that bit sounds pretty terribad.
Hysterical new Fox News exposé incoming: http://www.joystiq.com/2011/05/16/mass-effect-3-will-have-gay-romance-option-for-male-shepard/
Not fussed personally (Male Shep and Tali 4 lyfe), but it's about time they evened up.
I also have a romance with Tali. If she's got tentacles underneath that mask, I hope Kaidan doesn't mind being the rebound.
This is where I decide that people who play Mass Effect are *in actual fact* weird.
Yes, I think I agree with Mr_V... I do have a weird wife anyway...
They just don't get the significance of this for Mass Effect fans, since Mario and Zelda's been all about gay lovin' since day one. (am I doing it right?)
Now that we're down to 11 members, it's super easy to spot the trolls.
Good thing that I'm a 'kabouter'
http://i.imgur.com/RWCzH.jpg
Genuine LOL.
Heh, that actually sounded pretty interesting. Plus the rage-bitching would've been delicious.

How awesome would it be if Shephard's "life partner" comes and rearranges his captain's cabin and wardrobe and comments on him looking "fat in that suit hun" while on a mission! Seriously though, I'd be at least a little bi-curious during my first playthrough of ME3, knowing that the option is out there. I mean, you all feel the same right? Right?!
More people to love, I always say.
Releasing 6th March 2012
The ME3 gameplay videos I've seen so far raise a LOT of interesting questions about how they're going to handle the important choices made in ME1 and especially the end of ME2.
ME3 demo happening right now! http://www.gametrailers.com/netstorage/e3/e3-live.html

Friend of mine on Facebook:

“Upon hearing 'Garrus! What the fuck are you doing out of cover?!', the game will implement an emergency character AI reset… or, during romance sequences, make the character put on a condom.”

ME3 may or may not have multiplayer: http://www.joystiq.com/2011/08/06/mass-effect-3-will-wont-have-multiplayer-part-4-xbox-world-co/

This is the first I'd heard of it either way. Multiplayer seems like an odd fit for the ME games, but then, there are other games I could say that of, where it turned out wonderfully.
Haven't the co-op multiplayer rumours been floating around for a while now?
